laws.full_text:
an or equal to 200% of the federal minimum wage
Notice requirement: Must provide copy of agreement to employee prior to acceptance of offer
Exceptions: Generally banned for physicians and podiatrists
New Mexico

Reasonableness requirement: Must be reasonable in duration, geographic scope, and activities prohibited
Specific duration limit: n/a
Wage threshold: n/a
Notice requirement: n/a
Exceptions: Generally
laws.suggestion: Modify the non-compete clause to include specific reasonable terms: "This non-compete agreement is limited to a duration of [X] years, a geographic scope of [Y] miles, and activities that are substantially similar to those performed by the employee during their employment with the company, and only applies to employees earning above 200% of the federal minimum wage." Alternatively, consider removing the clause for certain professions, such as physicians and podiatrists, as they are generally exempt under New Mexico law.

review_notes.next_steps: Verify statute citations and effective dates
